News

Pst… I’m on the job market! Hire me!

  • I gave a colloquium talk (“Modified and unmodified numerals: lessons from genericity”) at Tel Aviv University on November 19, 2015.

  • In October 2015, I started my new position as a fellow at the Language, Logic, and Cognition Center of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem!

  • I gave a main session talk (“Severing maximality from fewer than: Evidence from genericity”) at Sinn und Bedeutung 20, which took place at the University of Tübingen, September 9-12, 2015. Read the handout!

  • I gave a talk (“Maximal informativity and modified numerals: the case of between”) at the Leiden-Utrecht Semantics Happenings (LUSH) group, at Utrecht University, on September 7, 2015.

  • I gave a talk (“Modified numerals, plurals, and boundedness”) at the Syntax and Semantics of Numerals workshop at the 48th Annual Meeting of the Societas Linguistica Europaea, which took place at Leiden University, September 2-5, 2015.
